source_sentence: 唵冒地質多母怛跛(二合引)那夜(引)彌想菩提月中有曇字。
translation: "Om bodhicitta mudrā tamā (citation needed) naya (citation needed), think of the word dharma in the moon of enlightenment.
It shines like a golden light.
It's like the sun radiating brightly.

source_sentence: 便即變成般若波羅蜜劍。
translation: It then becomes the sword of prajñā-pāramitā.
It's free of discrimination and capable of cutting off affliction.
He imagines it to be the sword of wisdom, and he truly says.
"Om ti seorje (duh) khaṅga.

source_sentence: 想其智劍漸漸增大遍周法界真言曰。
translation: "Suppose he imagines that his sword of wisdom gradually increases in size and pervades the Dharma realm, saying.
"Om svabhāra (bhāva) rājagṛha

source_sentence: 想其智劍漸漸收攝等自身量真言曰。
translation: "Suppose he imagines that his sword of wisdom is gradually gathering in equal measure with himself," he says.
"Om saṃhala khaṅga.

source_sentence: 為令智劍堅固不散復誦真言曰。
translation: "In order to make the sword of wisdom strong and not scatter, he again recites the true saying.

source_sentence: 唵涅哩(二合)荼底瑟姹(二合)渴誐想空中如來盡入智劍同為一體。
translation: "Om nirirye (duh) daṇḍiṃśeṣa (duh) khaṅga, suppose the Tathāgata in the sky completely enters the sword of wisdom as one.
He had this thought.

source_sentence: 如彼諸佛體性我亦同然真言曰。
translation: 'Thus, the essence of the buddhas is the same for me,' he said.

source_sentence: 唵(三)麼喻(引)含摩訶(引)三摩喻(引)含薩嚩怛他蘖多鼻二(去)冐(引)地渴誐怛麼(二合)句(引)含想其智劍漸漸變成文殊師利童真菩薩。
translation: "Om (3) moha (cited) contains moha (cited) samha (cited) contains sarva-tathāgata, tiller, nose, and two (departing) petals (cited), thirst, gaṅgata, tamer, and so forth (cited) contains the contemplation that the sword of wisdom gradually becomes Mañjuśrī, the child true bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 具大威德身著種種瓔珞。
translation: His body is adorned with a variety of jewelry, and he conceives of the five topknots on his head.
He conceives of the five topknots on his head.
In his right hand, he holds the sword of wisdom.
In his left hand, he holds a blue lotus flower.

source_sentence: 花上有般若波羅蜜經夾。
translation: On top of the flower is a folder of prajñā-pāramitā sūtras.
His body is the color of urushi gold.
He mentally recites the name of Ārāḍa-śramaṇa once.

source_sentence: 次結金剛智劍印　　止觀相叉作滿月　忍願皆竪如劍形　　印心及額喉頂上　即成護身堅本尊真言曰。
translation: Next, he makes the sign of the vajra sword of wisdom, stops and observes the shape of the forks of the moon, and tolerates vows that are all raised like a sword. He seals his heart and puts his forehead and throat on top of it, then he becomes a body protector.

source_sentence: 唵嚩日囉(二合)底乞叉拏(三合)地瑟姹(二合)娑嚩(二合)[牟*含]　次當灌頂結寶印　　二手相叉作為月　進力反屈如寶形　　禪智二度下相捻　置於額上分兩邊　　便結智拳如繫帛　兩手向前徐徐散　　當知已繫無垢繒真言曰。
translation: "When he sets the seal of the jewel at the consecration, his second hand is folded like a moon, and he bends it back into the shape of a jewel with his strength. He twists his meditation and wisdom two times and places them on his forehead at both ends, then he forms the fist of wisdom like a tied silk, and he slowly spreads it out with his two hands. He knows that he has tied it with the true chant, 'Immaculate silk.'

source_sentence: 唵嚩日囉(二合)囉怛曩(二合)莽隷鼻曬計囉鼻詵者娑嚩(二合)[牟*含]薩嚩母捺囉(二合)冥涅哩(二合)雉句嚕嚩囉迦嚩制娜鑁　次結寶劍自灌頂　　二手合掌屈進力　禪智皆屈入掌中　　置於額上分兩邊灌頂真言曰。
translation: "Om vajra(b), rātanān(b), manganian, sun, ketu, and sesshāva(b) [mu*ham], sama, mudnir(b), pheasant, goru, gorocan, and janaka. Next, he forms a tipping cloth with a jeweled sword, bends his palms together with the power of advancement, bends his meditation and wisdom into his palms, and places them on his forehead at both ends.

source_sentence: 唵囉怛曩(二合)俱舍仡哩耶(三合)吽(引)　次復結於甲冑印　　二手皆作金剛拳　置於心前竪進力　　左右二度想唵砧　想流清光為綠色　　心前三轉遶背後　復至臍下及兩膝　　又轉至臍遶腰後　從腰到心轉兩膊　　從膊至喉向頸後　復從頸後至額前　　從額至腦結智拳　徐徐散下如垂帶　　上觀旋轉如舞勢　二手相叉成滿月甲冑真言曰。
translation: The second hand is placed in front of the mind with the power of the vajra fist, and the second hand is placed in front of the mind with the power of the left and right, and the second hand is placed in front of the mind with the imagination of the anvil, with the imagination of a stream of clear light as green. The first three turns of the mind go around the back, reaching the bottom of the navel and the two knees, then the navel goes around the back of the waist, the two shoulders go from the waist to the heart, the shoulders go to the back of the neck, the throat goes to the back of the neck, the fist of wisdom goes from the back of the neck to the front of the head, and the forehead goes to the brain with the fist of wisdom that slowly spreads out like a draped belt.

source_sentence: 唵嚩日囉(二合)迦嚩左嚩日[口*梨](二合)句嚕嚩日囉(二合)嚩日囉(二合)娜含　次陳金剛拍掌儀　　二羽齊拍一相拍　由陳拍印真言并　　能令聖眾發歡喜　速獲本尊堅固體歡喜真言曰。
translation: "Om vajra-rāja (sextuplets), vajra-zuo, vajra-[mouth*ri] (sextuplets), juru-rāja (sextuplets), vajra-rāja (sextuplets), and nāgas (sextuplets). Next, he explains the vajra-palming ritual, tapping the two feathers together as one, and then he explains the seal of the seal, which causes the noble people to rejoice and quickly obtain the solid rejoicing of the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 唵嚩日囉(二合)底(引)乞叉拏(三合)覩使野(二合)斛(引)　次當行者座前觀　　八葉蓮花具鬚蘂　上觀師子妙高座　　座上復有七寶樓　中想七寶蓮花王　　上想曇字具威光　遍照法界靡不周　　其字變為金剛利　了了諦觀如本形　　召請菩薩入想身　二手作月進如鉤　　想身同於彼菩薩金剛鉤菩薩真言曰。
translation: "Om vajra-rāja (bk.) ti (citation) kiṃkara (triad) tuṣita (bk.) tuṣita (citation) Next, when the practitioner looks before the throne, he observes the eight-leaf lotus with its bearded heads. On the throne he observes the wonderfully high seat of the lion, on which there is another seven-jeweled tower. In the center he contemplates the seven-jeweled lotus king. Above him he contemplates the word dharma with its majestic radiance, which thoroughly illuminates the Dharma realm without fail. He completely observes the word as its original form, summons the bodhisattva to enter his contemplation body, and his second hand is made like a moon and advances like a hook. He contemplates his body as that of the bodhisattva, the vajra-hook bodhisattva, and the true saying is.
"Om aya (citation) freh...

source_sentence: 次當結索入尊身　　結月禪押智入掌　由此密印加持故　　變為一體無有差金剛索真言曰。
translation: "Next, you should wrap a rope around the body of the venerable and wrap it with the wisdom of the moon-moon meditation into his palm. Because of this esoteric seal's blessing, it becomes one without distinction," the vajra rope verbalizes.
"Om, akho, un, un.

source_sentence: 次當鎖印令堅固　　作月四度猶如環　由此祕印威力故　　悉令堅固而不變金剛鎖真言曰。
translation: "Next, he should lock his seal and make it strong. He should make the moon four times over just like a ring. Because of the power of this secret seal, all of them will be strong and unchanged," he said in the true words of the vajra lock.
唵係娑普(二合)吒鑁

source_sentence: 次結鈴印令歡喜　　禪智八掌如鈴鐸　令尊及眾皆歡喜　　加持令速妙成就金剛鈴真言曰。
translation: "Next, he sets the seal of the bell to make them rejoice. The eight palms of his meditation wisdom are like bells that make his honored friend and the crowd rejoice. He quickly and subtly accomplishes the vajra bell by applying the seal of support, saying.
"Om gandha-oxa-oxa.

source_sentence: 行者次當兩手捧遏伽想洗金剛利菩薩及諸眷屬足。
translation: Next, the practitioner should hold the conception of the ṛgā in both hands and wash the feet of Vajratī Bodhisattva and his retinue.

source_sentence: 或以百字真言加持遏伽。
translation: Or, he may bless the ṛṣiṇḍa with a hundred-word chant.
He then offers them the true words of curdha, saying.

source_sentence: 唵嚩日盧(二合)娜迦吽(引)
translation: "Om vajraka nāga un (citation).

source_sentence: 次結曼殊羯磨印　　二羽皆作金剛拳　禪羽置於自心上　　右手猶如執劍勢　由此羯麼妙印力　　身獲如尊等無異羯麼真言曰。
translation: "Next, he makes the sign of the mañjū karma, making both feathers into adamantine fists. He places the feathers on his heart and places his right hand in the position of holding a sword. By the power of this wonderful seal of karma, he attains the status of an honored one without distinction.

source_sentence: 唵嚩日囉(二合)底乞叉拏(三合)曇　次結金剛利劍印　　結月忍願申如劍　由此金剛利妙印　　當獲般若甚深智金剛利真言曰。
translation: "Om vajra-rāja (sextuple) ti-kṣaṇa (triple) dharma Next, he makes the sign of the vajra-vara (sword), conjures up the vow for forbearance of the moon, and manifests it like a sword. By this wonderful seal of vajra-vara, he'll attain the adamantine wisdom of the profound one," he says.
"Om hokkha bright na!

source_sentence: 次復當結內供養　　結月當心竪禪智　由結金剛嬉戲印　　速滿檀那波羅蜜金剛嬉戲真言曰。
translation: "Next, he should make an internal offering, make a moon-contemplating mind, and raise his mind to meditative wisdom. By making the sign for the playfulness of the vajras, he quickly completes the vajra playfulness of the dona-pāramitā," he says.
"Om mahallatī.

source_sentence: 次結金剛鬘供養　　依前嬉戲直申臂　由結此印加持故　　當滿淨戒波羅密金剛鬘真言曰。
translation: "Next, he forms an offering of a vajra garland based on the preceding playful act of straightening his arms. Because he forms this seal and bestows it, he will then complete the pure precepts, according to the true words of the Vajra Garland.
"Rulu (ruta) moha (citation) vai (ruta).

source_sentence: 次結金剛歌詠印　　鬘至臍口垂下散　由結金剛歌密印　　速獲安忍波羅蜜金剛歌真言曰。
translation: "Next, he forms the mudrā song mudrā to his navel and spreads it downward. By forming the mudrā song secret mudrā, he quickly attains peace and patience with the vajra song mantra.

source_sentence: 唵戍嚕(二合)怛囉(二合)掃磎
translation: "Om śoru (duh) tara (duh) sahā chai.

source_sentence: 次結金剛舞供養　　二手拳旋如舞勢　由結舞印加持故　　速滿精進波羅蜜金剛舞印真言曰。
translation: "Next, he makes an offering of the vajra dance, twirling his fists with his hands in the manner of a dance. Because of the blessing of the dance mudrā, he quickly completes the vajra dance mudrā," he says.
"Om svabhūr.

source_sentence: 次結金剛外供養　　二手作月向下散　由結燒香印力故　　當證靜慮波羅蜜金剛燒香真言曰。
translation: "Next, he forms an offering to the outside of the vajra, and his second hand scatters it like the moon moving downward. Because of the power of the incense-burning seal, he will realize the true saying, 'Jingliu pāramitā vajra-burning incense.'

source_sentence: 唵鉢囉(二合)賀攞(二合)儞(引)寧(上)　次結金剛散花印　　結月向上如散花　由此散花印加持　　速證般若波羅蜜金剛散花真言曰。
translation: "Om prajñāhāra (btn.) hejñānī (btn.) nin (supra), secondly, he forms the sign for scattering flowers from the vajra, and then he forms the moon upward like a scattering flower. By applying this scattering flower sign, he quickly realizes the true verse for scattering flowers from the vajra of the perfection of meditation: 'Oh, prajñā (btn.) hejñānī.'
"Om phala (citation needed) ga ming!

source_sentence: 次結金剛燈明印　　作月禪智頭相著　由結金剛燈明印　　當得方便波羅蜜金剛燈明真言曰。
translation: "Second, he sets the vajra lamp light seal, making the head of moon meditation wisdom to adhere to. By setting the vajra lamp light seal, he will attain the vajra lamp light mantra of the perfection of skillful means, which is.
"Yasu-tejaprabhā (citation needed) tiller.

source_sentence: 次結金剛塗香印　　月當胸散如塗香　由結塗香印加持　　速滿誓願波羅蜜金剛塗香真言曰。
translation: "Next, he forms the sign for applying incense to the vajra, which is applied to the moon's chest and spreads like incense. He forms the sign for applying incense, and then he blesses it with the vow to quickly fulfill the pāramitā.
"Om sukandangni (Ni yixi).

source_sentence: 行者次應誦一百八名讚供養本尊。
translation: Next, the practitioner should recite the one hundred and eight hymns of praise for the original honored one.
He should also make the vajra-sharp sword seal.

source_sentence: 於心上誦百字真言加持自身。
translation: He recites a hundred true words of praise over his heart to bless himself.

source_sentence: 假使過去世中造種種惡業五無間等一切罪障。
translation: Suppose he created all kinds of bad actions, five kinds of unremitting sins, and other hindrances in a past life.
Because of this hundred-syllable blessing, all the sins and hindrances will go away.
All the harmful hindrances will all cease.
He'll see his body and attain śūraṃgama-samādhi.

source_sentence: 若心散亂數誦此明或一七三七乃至七七一百八遍。
translation: If his mind is distracted, he recites this teaching several times, whether it's one, seven, three, seven, or even seven, seven, one, or one hundred and eight times.
His mind is free of perceptual attachments and quickly attains concentration.
One Hundred Syllable Verse

source_sentence: 唵渴誐薩怛嚩(二合一)三麼耶麼努播(引)攞耶(二合二)渴誐薩怛嚩(二合三)底吠(二合)怒跛底瑟姹(二合四)涅哩(二合)住(茶護反)銘婆(去)嚩(五)素覩使喻(二合)銘婆(去)嚩(六)阿(上)拏囉訖覩(二合)銘婆(去)嚩(七)素布使喻(二合引)銘婆(去)嚩(八)薩嚩悉朕(提飲反)銘鉢囉(二合)也瑳(九)薩嚩羯磨素者銘(十)質多失唎(二合)藥句嚕(十一)吽(引)訶訶訶訶斛(引)婆誐鑁(十二)薩嚩怛他蘖多(十三)渴誐麼銘門(上)者(十四)渴倪(倪以反)婆嚩(十五)摩訶三摩耶薩怛嚩(二合)惡(引十六)不散前印。
translation: 唵渴誐薩怛嚩(二合一)三麼耶麼努播(引)攞耶(二合二)渴誐薩怛嚩(二合三)底吠(二合)怒跛底瑟姹(二合四)涅哩(二合)住(茶護反)銘婆(去)嚩(五)素覩使喻(二合)銘婆(去)嚩(六)阿(上)拏囉訖覩(二合)銘婆(去)嚩(七)素布使喻(二合引)銘婆(去)嚩(八)薩嚩悉朕(提飲反)銘鉢囉(二合)也瑳(九)薩嚩羯磨素者銘(十)質多失唎(二合)藥句嚕(十一)吽(引)訶訶訶訶斛(引)婆誐鑁(十二)薩嚩怛他蘖多(十三)渴誐麼銘門(上)者(十四)渴倪(倪以反)婆嚩(十五)摩訶三摩耶薩怛嚩(二合)惡(引十六)不散前印。
He observes that there's an original venerable in front of him.
He also conceives of himself as being like the original honored one.

source_sentence: 了了諦觀即誦五字陀羅尼。
translation: He then recites the five-syllable dhāraṇī with complete understanding and insight.
He might recite it in the language of the Vajrasamādhi.
Or he might recite it in clear lotus language.
Or, he recites it seven times or three times.
He puts his seal on the top of his head and dismisses it.

source_sentence: 次即把念珠當心念誦不緩不急。
translation: Next, he puts his rosary in his mind and recites it without lag or haste.

source_sentence: 或一百八遍或一千乃至一萬遍。
translation: It may be recited a hundred or eight times, or a thousand or even ten thousand times.
After reciting the rosary a few times, he puts the rosary in his hand and places it on the top of his head.
He holds the rosary in his hands and places it on his head.
Then he puts it in its original place.
Suppose someone recites samādhi.
He should mentally contemplate the great perfect mirror wisdom.
In it, he spreads the five-syllable mantra.
He fully and truly observes them.
It's appropriate to the meaning.
His mind is united with the perfection of wisdom.
This is called the recitation of samādhi.
If he becomes physically lazy, he'll then make the preaching mudrā.
He then makes the seal of the venerable's sword.
He recites the five-syllable dhāraṇī seven times.

source_sentence: 復以八大供養供養諸佛。
translation: He then makes eight great offerings to the buddhas.
He praises and extols them with beautiful sounds and words.
He offers guardian water.
He uses the sign of subduing the three worlds to rotate left and untie the borders.
He then made the sign of the vajra sword.
He presented the sages with the seal of the vajra sword.
Each returned to his original palace.
The true saying was.

source_sentence: 唵訖哩(二合)覩(引)嚩(無莫反一)薩嚩薩怛嚩(二合)囉他(二合二)悉地捺多(引三)也他(引)努誐(引上四)蘖縒持挽(二合)沒馱尾灑焰(五)布曩囉(引)誐(六)麼囊(引)也都(七)唵渴誐薩怛嚩(二合)目(八)作此法已。
translation: "Om keri (bk.) tu (cited) va (no mo counter) i) sarva (bk.) sarta (bk.) rata (bk.) siddhi (cited) yatta (cited) nugga (cited) iv) tiller (bk.) buddha (cited) wandering (v) po (cited) ga (vi) monang (cited) yadu (vii) om kharga sarta (bk.) mu (viii) After performing this ritual, he recites the blessing using the seal of samaya to seal four places.

source_sentence: 重以三麼耶印誦加持明以印四處。
translation: He repeats the recitation with the samaya mudrā, using the blessing to seal the four places.
He then consecrates his head.
He puts on his vajra armor.
He pays homage to the four buddhas in the four directions according to the previous four rituals.
He confesses his sins and makes a vow.
Then, he relies on a quiet place.

source_sentence: 嚴以香花住本尊三摩地。
translation: He adorned himself with incense and flowers and stayed in the venerable's meditative absorption.

source_sentence: 讀誦方廣一切大乘經典大般若大品。
translation: He recites the recitation of the Mahāyāna scriptures in their entirety, the great chapter of Mahāprajñāpāramitā.
Even Mañjuśrī Prajñāpāramitā and so forth.
He practices the scriptures as he wishes.

source_sentence: 若有智者依此法　　晝夜四時精進修　見世證得歡喜地　　後十六生成正覺文殊師利忿怒陀羅尼唵嚩日囉(二合)底乞叉拏(三合)俱嚕(二合)馱瞋那瞋那吽(引)泮吒用此真言護身辟除結界。
translation: If there's a wise person who relies on this teaching and diligently cultivates it during the four periods of the day and night, then he'll see the world and realize the stage of joy in the next 16 generations.

source_sentence: 淨諸香花及一切供具等並得。
translation: It also purifies fragrant flowers, makes all offerings, and so forth.

source_sentence: 當願眾生遇此教　　曼殊常為善知識　速證般若善巧智　　疾成無上兩足尊五字陀羅尼阿囉跛者曩唵嚩日囉(二合)底乞叉拏(三合)唵耨佉泚(去)娜唵渴誐蘖囉(二合)欠(平)唵渴誐薩怛嚩(二合)金剛頂經瑜伽文殊師利菩薩法一品
translation: May sentient beings encounter this teaching, and may Mañjuśrī always be a good teacher who quickly realizes the adroit wisdom of prajñā and quickly becomes a five-syllable dhāraṇī, the unsurpassed two-legged honored one.
